H0.text: Chemical potential energy is the type of potential energy that dynamite exemplifies.

H1.text: Carbon is the type of potential energy that dynamite exemplifies.

H2.text: Mineral is the type of potential energy that dynamite exemplifies.

H3.text: Thermal is the type of potential energy for which dynamite is an example.

A4.text: Chemical potential energy is a form of potential energy related to the structural arrangement of atoms or molecules.

A5.text: Chemical energy is the energy of chemical substances that is released when the substances undergo a chemical reaction and transform into other substances.
